public class AbstractResourceConsumer
extends AbstractBaseWorker

Resource consumer that knows the name of its resource wrapper manager.

Method Detail

getManagerName

public String getManagerName()
Gets the name of the ResourceWrapper manager that will provide this worker with the appropriate resources.

Returns:
Returns the name of the resource manager.

setManagerName

public void setManagerName(String managerName)
Sets the name of the ResourceWrapper manager that will provide this worker with the appropriate resources. This method is provided, in order to support a case, where an AbstractResourceConsumer needs to set the resource manager name to some of its children.

Parameters:
managerName - The managerName to set.

init

public void init(Provider parent)
          throws InitializationException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Introduces the runtime context (environment) to the worker. The parent provides the runtime context. The runtime context can be anything that facilitates access to any back-end system (Databases, Files, Application Server etc).
Different implementations of Worker, will require from their parent provider resources of different types. Sub-interfaces of Provider can provide resources of any type. The implementations of worker must get the specific sub-type of Provider by their parent by calling the method parent.getProvider(subclass) where subclass is the sub-interface of Provider that is required.

Specified by:
init in interface Worker
Overrides:
init in class AbstractBaseWorker
Parameters:
parent - The runtime provider
Throws:
InitializationException - When the parent fails to provide the resources required by the worker.
